summary_points: Purpose: To alter the rates of the standard allowance, limited capability for work (LCW) element, and limited capability for work and work-related activity (LCWRA) element of Universal Credit, and income-related Employment and Support Allowance (ESA IR) (Preamble).

Key Definitions: Important terms include 'standard allowance' (s.1(6)(c)), 'LCWRA element' (s.3(2)(a)), 'LCW element' (s.3(2)(b)), 'pre-2026 claimant' (Sch.1, para 2, 4), and 'severe conditions criteria claimant' (Sch.1, para 2, 6).

Eligibility: Eligibility for specific Universal Credit elements is differentiated for 'pre-2026 claimants', 'severe conditions criteria claimants', and 'terminally ill' claimants regarding the LCWRA element (s.2(1), Sch.1, para 3, 4, 6). A 'severe conditions criteria claimant' is defined by specific, lifelong bodily or mental disablement diagnosed by a healthcare professional (Sch.1, para 6).

Obligations: The Secretary of State (and NI equivalent) must exercise powers to ensure standard allowance rates (s.1(1)) and protected LCWRA amounts (s.4(1)) are increased for tax years 2026-27 to 2029-30 according to specified calculations (s.1(2), s.4(2)).

Enforcement: No specific enforcement mechanisms or penalties are detailed within this Act. The Act relies on existing powers in other legislation (e.g., Welfare Reform Act 2012, Social Security Administration Act 1992) for implementation.

sections.definitions:
Section 1(6): Defines "consumer prices index", "relevant power", "the standard allowance", and "the standard allowance 'for' a tax year".
Section 1(7): Defines "tax year" and "tax year 2025-26".
Section 3(2): Defines "the LCWRA element" and "the LCW element".
Section 4(3): Defines "the protected LCWRA amount", "the LCWRA element", "the standard allowance", and "reference to an amount or allowance 'for' a tax year".
Section 4(4): Defines "the 'relevant CPI percentage'" and "the 'consumer prices index'".
Section 5(5): Defines "an 'amount of the ESA IR personal allowance'", "an 'amount of an ESA IR disability premium'", "the ESA IR support component", "the ESA IR work-related activity component", and "a reference to an amount or component 'for' a tax year".
Schedule 1, paragraph 2: Inserts definitions for "pre-2026 claimant" and "severe conditions criteria claimant" into regulation 2 of the Universal Credit Regulations 2013.
Schedule 1, paragraph 4 (Regulation 27A): Defines "Meaning of 'pre-2026 claimant'".
Schedule 1, paragraph 6 (Regulation 40A): Defines "Severe conditions criteria claimant" and "NHS services".
Schedule 2, paragraph 1(5): Defines "consumer prices index", "relevant power", "the standard allowance", and "the standard allowance 'for' a tax year" for Northern Ireland.
Schedule 2, paragraph 1(6): Defines "tax year" and "tax year 2025-26" for Northern Ireland.
Schedule 2, paragraph 2(2): Inserts definitions for "pre-2026 claimant" and "severe conditions criteria claimant" into regulation 2 of the Universal Credit Regulations (Northern Ireland) 2016.
Schedule 2, paragraph 2(4) (Regulation 28A): Defines "Meaning of 'pre-2026 claimant'" for Northern Ireland.
Schedule 2, paragraph 2(6) (Regulation 41A): Defines "Severe conditions criteria claimant" and "health and social care services" for Northern Ireland.
Schedule 2, paragraph 3(3): Defines "the protected LCWRA amount", "the LCWRA element", "the standard allowance", and "reference to an amount or allowance 'for' a tax year" for Northern Ireland.
Schedule 2, paragraph 3(4): Defines "the 'relevant CPI percentage'" and "the 'consumer prices index'" for Northern Ireland.
Schedule 2, paragraph 4(4): Defines "an 'amount of the ESA IR personal allowance'" and "a reference to an amount 'for' a tax year" for Northern Ireland.
sections.obligations:
Section 1(1): The Secretary of State must exercise a relevant power to secure that standard allowance amounts for tax years 2026-27 to 2029-30 are at least the amounts calculated in accordance with subsection (2).
Section 4(1): The Secretary of State must exercise the power in section 9(2) or 12(3) of the Welfare Reform Act 2012 to increase the protected LCWRA amount or any amount of the standard allowance for tax years 2026-27 to 2029-30 if necessary to achieve the result in subsection (2).
Section 5(3): The Secretary of State must exercise the power in section 4(2)(a) or (6)(c) of the Welfare Reform Act 2007 to increase any amount of an ESA IR disability premium, the ESA IR support component, or any amount of the ESA IR personal allowance for tax years 2026-27 to 2029-30 if necessary to achieve the result in subsection (4).
Schedule 2, paragraph 1(1): The Department for Communities in Northern Ireland must exercise a relevant power to secure that standard allowance amounts for tax years 2026-27 to 2029-30 are at least the amounts calculated in accordance with sub-paragraph (2).
Schedule 2, paragraph 3(1): The Department for Communities in Northern Ireland must exercise the power in Article 14(2) or 17(3) of the Welfare Reform (Northern Ireland) Order 2015 to increase the protected LCWRA amount or any amount of the standard allowance for tax years 2026-27 to 2029-30 if necessary to achieve the result in sub-paragraph (2).
Schedule 2, paragraph 4(2): The Department for Communities in Northern Ireland must exercise the power in section 4(2)(a) or (6)(c) of the Welfare Reform Act (Northern Ireland) 2007 to increase any amount of the severe disability premium or enhanced disability premium, the amount specified in paragraph 13 of Part 4 of Schedule 4 to the Employment and Support Allowance Regulations (Northern Ireland) 2008, or any amount of the ESA IR personal allowance for tax years 2026-27 to 2029-30 if necessary to achieve the result in sub-paragraph (3).
sections.responsibilities:
Section 1(1): The Secretary of State is responsible for securing that the amounts of the standard allowance for tax years 2026-27 to 2029-30 meet the specified minimums.
Section 4(1): The Secretary of State is responsible for increasing the protected LCWRA amount or any amount of the standard allowance for tax years 2026-27 to 2029-30 if necessary to achieve the specified result.
Section 5(3): The Secretary of State is responsible for increasing any amount of an ESA IR disability premium, the ESA IR support component, or any amount of the ESA IR personal allowance for tax years 2026-27 to 2029-30 if necessary to achieve the specified result.
Schedule 2, paragraph 1(1): The Department for Communities in Northern Ireland is responsible for securing that the amounts of the standard allowance for tax years 2026-27 to 2029-30 meet the specified minimums.
Schedule 2, paragraph 3(1): The Department for Communities in Northern Ireland is responsible for increasing the protected LCWRA amount or any amount of the standard allowance for tax years 2026-27 to 2029-30 if necessary to achieve the specified result.
Schedule 2, paragraph 4(2): The Department for Communities in Northern Ireland is responsible for increasing certain ESA IR disability premiums, the ESA IR support component, or any amount of the ESA IR personal allowance for tax years 2026-27 to 2029-30 if necessary to achieve the specified result.
sections.eligibility:
Section 2(1): Refers to eligibility for the LCWRA element based on being a "claimant with limited capability for work and work-related activity, other than a pre-2026 claimant, a severe conditions criteria claimant or a claimant who is terminally ill" or a "pre-2026 claimant, severe conditions criteria claimant or claimant who is terminally ill".
Schedule 1, paragraph 4 (Regulation 27A): Defines a "pre-2026 claimant" as one who was entitled to an award of universal credit including the LCWRA element before 6 April 2026 and has been continuously entitled since then.
Schedule 1, paragraph 6 (Regulation 40A): Defines a "severe conditions criteria claimant" based on an assessment under Part 4 of the Universal Credit Regulations 2013, having limited capability for work and work-related activity, and at least one descriptor from Schedule 7 constantly applying for the rest of their life, diagnosed by an appropriately qualified health care professional.
Schedule 2, paragraph 2(5): Refers to eligibility for the LCWRA element in Northern Ireland based on similar claimant categories as Section 2(1).
Schedule 2, paragraph 2(4) (Regulation 28A): Defines a "pre-2026 claimant" for Northern Ireland with similar criteria as Schedule 1, paragraph 4.
Schedule 2, paragraph 2(6) (Regulation 41A): Defines a "severe conditions criteria claimant" for Northern Ireland with similar criteria as Schedule 1, paragraph 6.
sections.payments:
Section 1(1)-(4): Details the calculation of the standard allowance for tax years 2026-27 to 2029-30, including Step 1 (base amounts), Step 2 (increase by relevant CPI percentage), and Step 3 (increase by relevant uplift percentage, with a table of percentages).
Section 2(1): Specifies a new LCWRA element amount of "£217.26" for certain claimants.
Section 3(1): States that annual up-rating provisions of section 150 of the Social Security Administration Act 1992 do not apply to the standard allowance, LCWRA element, or LCW element for specific tax years.
Section 4(2): Describes the objective for protected LCWRA amount and standard allowance sums: the sum for the current tax year must be at least the sum for the previous tax year increased by the relevant CPI percentage.
Section 5(1): Applies the provisions of Section 1 to the amounts of the ESA IR personal allowance for tax years 2026-27 to 2029-30.
Section 5(2): States that annual up-rating provisions do not apply to any amount of an ESA IR disability premium, the ESA IR support component, or the ESA IR work-related activity component for specific tax years.
Section 5(4): Describes the objective for sums of ESA IR disability premium, support component, and personal allowance: the sum for the current tax year must be at least the sum for the previous tax year increased by the relevant CPI percentage.
Schedule 2, paragraph 1(1)-(4): Details the calculation of the standard allowance for tax years 2026-27 to 2029-30 for Northern Ireland, including Step 1, Step 2, and Step 3 (with a table of uplift percentages).
Schedule 2, paragraph 2(5): Specifies a new LCWRA element amount of "£217.26" for certain claimants in Northern Ireland.
Schedule 2, paragraph 3(2): Describes the objective for protected LCWRA amount and standard allowance sums in Northern Ireland: the sum for the current tax year must be at least the sum for the previous tax year increased by the relevant CPI percentage.
Schedule 2, paragraph 4(1): Applies the provisions of Schedule 2, paragraph 1 to the amounts of the ESA IR personal allowance for tax years 2026-27 to 2029-30 in Northern Ireland.
Schedule 2, paragraph 4(3): Describes the objective for sums of ESA IR disability premium, support component, and personal allowance in Northern Ireland: the sum for the current tax year must be at least the sum for the previous tax year increased by the relevant CPI percentage.

checks.evidence: Section 1(6), 1(7), 3(2), 4(3), 4(4), 5(5) and Schedule 1, paragraphs 2, 4, 6, and Schedule 2, paragraphs 1(5), 1(6), 2(2), 2(4), 2(6), 3(3), 3(4), 4(4) all contain definitions of key terms.

The Universal Credit Act 2025 primarily focuses on altering the rates and elements of universal credit and amends existing regulations (e.g., Universal Credit Regulations 2013). It refers to other legislation, such as the Welfare Reform Act 2012, for the definition of 'standard allowance' (Section 1(6)(c)) and 'assessment period' (Section 1(6)(d)), indicating that the core eligibility criteria for Universal Credit are established in those external acts and regulations, not specified within this Act. While Schedule 1 introduces definitions for 'pre-2026 claimant' (Regulation 27A) and 'severe conditions criteria claimant' (Regulation 40A), these are specific to certain elements and amendments, not the general eligibility for Universal Credit.
